text: Fred Hume (1898-1978) was an Australian professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. He played for Eastern Suburbs and St. George in the New South Wales Rugby League (NSWRL) competition. ==Career== A centre, Hume played 18 matches for Eastern Suburbs club in the years (1920–22) before joining the St. George club the following season. Hume played for St George between 1923–1926. In 1921 Hume represented New South Wales in an interstate match against Queensland. ==References== * The Encyclopedia Of Rugby League Players; Alan Whiticker & Clen Hudson Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Sydney Roosters players Category:St. George Dragons players Category:1898 births Category:1978 deaths Category:New South Wales rugby league team players
title: Fred Hume (rugby league)
